context.p: The six strings (in decreasing thickness) of the traditional guitar are most commonly tuned 'EADGBE' (standard tuning). Each string increases a perfect fourth, i.e. five half-tone steps, higher than the string preceding it. The exception is the interval between the second and third strings (the B string), in which the 4th-fret note on the third string is equivalent to the open second string.

step.cmd: Ensure the settings are configured for standard tuning.
Strike each string, and turn its tuning key until the tuner indicated the proper note is reached.
